Criterion Text In: Completion of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures
Criterion Text Out: Completion of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures

Criterion Text In: Patients must agree to tissue collection for correlative studies at the specified timepoints
Criterion Text Out: Patients must agree to tissue collection for correlative studies at the specified timepoints
Criterion Rule: "tissue collection" is True AND "at the specified timepoints" is True

Criterion Text In: Patients must consent to the MD Anderson Immunotherapy Platform laboratory protocol PA13-0291
Criterion Text Out: Patients must consent to the MD Anderson Immunotherapy Platform laboratory protocol PA13-0291

Criterion Text In: Male aged 18 years and above
Criterion Text Out: Male aged 18 years and above

Criterion Text In: Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma
Criterion Text Out: Histologically or cytologically confirmed prostate carcinoma

Criterion Text In: Presence of metastatic disease documented on imaging studies (bone scan, computed tomography [CT] and/or magnetic resonance imaging [MRI] scans)
Criterion Text Out: Presence of metastatic disease documented on imaging studies (bone scan, computed tomography [CT] and/or magnetic resonance imaging [MRI] scans)

Criterion Text In:
Patients must meet at least one of the following AVPC criteria:
* Histologically proven small cell (neuroendocrine) prostate carcinoma
* Exclusive visceral metastases
* Predominantly lytic bone metastases identified by plain x-ray or CT scan
* Bulky (>= 5 cm in longest dimension) lymphadenopathy or high-grade tumor mass in prostate/pelvis
* Low PSA (=< 10 ng/mL) at initial presentation (prior to androgen ablation or at symptomatic progression in the castrate-setting) plus high volume (>= 20) bone metastases
* Elevated serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) (>= 2 x ULN) or elevated serum carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) (>= 2 x ULN) in the absence of other etiologies
* Short interval (=< 180 days) to castrate-resistant progression following initiation of hormonal therapy
* Known loss or mutation (by Clinical Laboratory Improvement Act [CLIA] certified molecular testing, immunohistochemistry [IHC] and/or deoxyribonucleic acid [DNA] sequencing) in at least 2 of Tp53, RB1 and PTEN defined as:
** AVPC determination by immunohistochemistry. As previously described, tumor samples are considered negative (and thus abnormal) for RB1 and PTEN if their labeling index is =< 10% and positive (and thus aberrant) for Tp53 if their labeling index is >= 10%, where the labeling index is defined as the percentage of positive cells, and calculated as the number of positively stained epithelial cells divided by the total number of epithelial cells, at X200 magnification
** AVPC determination by DNA sequencing. As previously described, the TP53, RB1 and PTEN genes will be considered aberrant if they contain exonic nonsynonymous missense or stop-gain mutations, frameshift or non frameshift indels (insertions or deletions), and/or copy number losses
** Patients who have castration-resistant disease progression per RECIST in the absence of PSA values rising to >= 1.0ng/ml as per Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 (PCWG3) PSA progression criteria
Criterion Text Out:
Patients must meet at least one of the following AVPC criteria:
* Histologically proven small cell (neuroendocrine) prostate carcinoma
* Exclusive visceral metastases
* Predominantly lytic bone metastases identified by plain x-ray or CT scan
* Bulky (>= 5 cm in longest dimension) lymphadenopathy or high-grade tumor mass in prostate/pelvis
* Low PSA (=< 10 ng/mL) at initial presentation (prior to androgen ablation or at symptomatic progression in the castrate-setting) plus high volume (>= 20) bone metastases
* Elevated serum lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) (>= 2 x ULN) or elevated serum carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) (>= 2 x ULN) in the absence of other etiologies
* Short interval (=< 180 days) to castrate-resistant progression following initiation of hormonal therapy
* Known loss or mutation (by CLIA certified molecular testing, IHC and/or DNA sequencing) in at least 2 of Tp53, RB1 and PTEN defined as:
** AVPC determination by immunohistochemistry. As previously described, tumor samples are considered negative (and thus abnormal) for RB1 and PTEN if their labeling index is =< 10% and positive (and thus aberrant) for Tp53 if their labeling index is >= 10%, where the labeling index is defined as the percentage of positive cells, and calculated as the number of positively stained epithelial cells divided by the total number of epithelial cells, at X200 magnification
** AVPC determination by DNA sequencing. As previously described, the TP53, RB1 and PTEN genes will be considered aberrant if they contain exonic nonsynonymous missense or stop-gain mutations, frameshift or non frameshift indels (insertions or deletions), and/or copy number losses
** Patients who have castration-resistant disease progression per RECIST in the absence of PSA values rising to >= 1.0ng/ml as per PCWG3 PSA progression criteria

Criterion Text In: Patients must have documented evidence of progressive disease as defined by any of the following: a) PSA progression: minimum of 2 rising values (3 measurements) obtained a minimum of 7 days apart with the last result being at least >= 1.0 ng/mL; b) New or increasing non-bone disease (RECIST); c) Positive bone scan with 2 or more new lesions (Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 [PCWG3]); d) Increasing symptoms unequivocally attributed to disease progression as judged by the treating physician and the principal investigator (PI)
Criterion Text Out: Patients must have documented evidence of progressive disease as defined by any of the following: a) PSA progression: minimum of 2 rising values (3 measurements) obtained a minimum of 7 days apart with the last result being at least >= 1.0 ng/mL; b) New or increasing non-bone disease (RECIST); c) Positive bone scan with 2 or more new lesions (Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 [PCWG3]); d) Increasing symptoms unequivocally attributed to disease progression as judged by the treating physician and the principal investigator (PI)
Criterion Rule: "PSA progression", "New or increasing non-bone disease (RECIST)", "Positive bone scan with 2 or more new lesions (Prostate Cancer Working Group 3 [PCWG3])", "Increasing symptoms unequivocally attributed to disease progression as judged by the treating physician and the principal investig

Criterion Text In: Surgically or ongoing medically castrated, with baseline testosterone levels of =< 50 ng/dL (=< 2.0 nM). Exception: Patients with de novo primary small cell carcinoma of the prostate may begin chemotherapy on study once treatment with an LHRH agonist or antagonist has been initiated, even if testosterone levels have not reached =< 50ng/dL
Criterion Text Out: Surgically or ongoing medically castrated, with baseline testosterone levels of =< 50 ng/dL (=< 2.0 nM). Exception: Patients with de novo primary small cell carcinoma of the prostate may begin chemotherapy on study once treatment with an LHRH agonist or antagonist has been initiated, even if testosterone levels have not reached =< 50ng/dL
Criterion Rule: "Surgically or ongoing medically castrated" AND ("baseline testosterone levels of =< 50 ng/dL (=< 2.0 nM)" OR "de novo primary small cell carcinoma of the prostate")

Criterion Text In: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of =< 2
Criterion Text Out: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of =< 2

Criterion Text In: Hemoglobin >= 10.0 g/dL (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case hemoglobin > 8 g/dL is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration). Patient may have blood transfusions prior to study enrollment
Criterion Text Out: Hemoglobin >= 10.0 g/dL (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case hemoglobin > 8 g/dL is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration). Patient may have blood transfusions prior to study enrollment
Disease: Anemia, Bone Marrow Infiltration by Tumor, Blood Transfusion

Criterion Text In: Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >= 1.5 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case ANC > 1,000/mm^3 is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: Absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >= 1.5 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case ANC > 1,000/mm^3 is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Disease: Neutropenia, Bone Marrow Infiltration by Tumor

Criterion Text In: White blood cells (WBC) > 3 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case WBC > 2 x 10^9/L is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: White blood cells (WBC) > 3 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case WBC > 2 x 10^9/L is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)

Criterion Text In: No features suggestive of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)/acute myeloid leukemia (AML) on peripheral blood smear (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: No features suggestive of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)/acute myeloid leukemia (AML) on peripheral blood smear (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Rule: LK MDS == False, MDS == False, LK AML == False, AML == False

Criterion Text In: Platelet count >= 100 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case platelet > 50,000/mm^3 is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: Platelet count >= 100 x 10^9/L (unless due to bone marrow infiltration by tumor, in which case platelet > 50,000/mm^3 is allowed) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Rule: PLT >= 100*10^9/L && BM_Tumor == False || PLT >= 50*10^9/L && BM_Tumor == True

Criterion Text In: Total bilirubin =< 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (except for patients with known Gilbertâ€™s disease) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: Total bilirubin =< 1.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) (except for patients with known Gilbertâ€™s disease) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)

Criterion Text In: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT]) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase [SGPT]) =< 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (unless liver metastases are present in which case it must be =< 5 x ULN) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT]) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT) (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase [SGPT]) =< 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (unless liver metastases are present in which case it must be =< 5 x ULN) (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)

Criterion Text In: Calculated creatinine clearance (Cockcroft-Gault equation) >= 30 mL/min (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)
Criterion Text Out: Calculated creatinine clearance (Cockcroft-Gault equation) >= 30 mL/min (within 7 days prior to treatment registration)

Criterion Text In: Able to swallow study drugs whole as a tablet/capsule
Criterion Text Out: Able to swallow study drugs whole as a tablet/capsule

Criterion Text In: Patients who have partners of childbearing potential (e.g. female that has not been surgically sterilized or who are not amenorrheic for >= 12 months) must be willing to use a method of birth control in addition to adequate barrier protection as determined to be acceptable by the investigator during the study and for 3 months after last dose of niraparib administration and 5 months after the last dose of cetrelimab. In addition men should not donate sperm during this period. Please note that the efficacy of hormonal contraception may be decreased if administered with niraparib
Criterion Text Out: Patients who have partners of childbearing potential (e.g. female that has not been surgically sterilized or who are not amenorrheic for >= 12 months) must be willing to use a method of birth control in addition to adequate barrier protection as determined to be acceptable by the investigator during the study and for 3 months after last dose of niraparib administration and 5 months after the last dose of cetrelimab. In addition men should not donate sperm during this period. Please note that the efficacy of hormonal contraception may be decreased if administered with niraparib
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Partner of childbearing potential" AND Willingness to use a method of birth control is True

Criterion Text In: Patient is willing and able to comply with the protocol for the duration of the study including undergoing treatment and scheduled visits and examinations including follow up
Criterion Text Out: Patient is willing and able to comply with the protocol for the duration of the study including undergoing treatment and scheduled visits and examinations including follow up
Criterion Rule: "willing and able to comply with the protocol for the duration of the study including undergoing treatment and scheduled visits and examinations including follow up" is True

Criterion Text In: Any prior treatment for castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC) with carboplatin, cisplatin, cabazitaxel, PARP-inhibitor or an anti-PD1 or anti-PDL1 inhibitor
Criterion Text Out: Any prior treatment for castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC) with carboplatin, cisplatin, cabazitaxel, PARP-inhibitor or an anti-PD1 or anti-PDL1 inhibitor
Procedure: Carboplatin, Cisplatin, Cabazitaxel, PARP-inhibitor, Anti-PD1, Anti-PDL1 Inhibitor

Criterion Text In: Patients who have received more than one line of chemotherapy. Any number of prior hormonal or targeted therapies are allowed
Criterion Text Out: Patients who have received more than one line of chemotherapy. Any number of prior hormonal or targeted therapies are allowed
Criterion Rule: "Chemotherapy" is True OR "Hormonal Therapy" is True OR "Targeted Therapy" is True

Criterion Text In: Patients who have not recovered from adverse events secondary to systemic therapy (except for luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone [LHRH] agonist or antagonist treatment for prostate cancer, and bisphosphonates or RANK ligand inhibitors for bone strengthening), major surgery or radiotherapy for the treatment of prostate cancer to a grade =< 2
Criterion Text Out: Patients who have not recovered from adverse events secondary to systemic therapy (except for luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone [LHRH] agonist or antagonist treatment for prostate cancer, and bisphosphonates or RANK ligand inhibitors for bone strengthening), major surgery or radiotherapy for the treatment of prostate cancer to a grade =< 2
Criterion Rule: "Adverse events secondary to systemic therapy (except for luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone [LHRH] agonist or antagonist treatment for prostate cancer, and bisphosphonates or RANK ligand inhibitors for bone strengthening)" is False OR "Major surgery or radiotherapy for the treatment of prostate cancer to a grade =< 2" is False

Criterion Text In: Any unresolved toxicity (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] grade >= 2) from previous anti-cancer therapy. Subjects with irreversible toxicity that is not reasonably expected to be exacerbated by the investigational product may be included (e.g., hearing loss, peripherally neuropathy)
Criterion Text Out: Any unresolved toxicity (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] grade >= 2) from previous anti-cancer therapy. Subjects with irreversible toxicity that is not reasonably expected to be exacerbated by the investigational product may be included (e.g., hearing loss, peripherally neuropathy)
Criterion Rule: "Any unresolved toxicity (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] grade >= 2) from previous anti-cancer therapy" is False OR "Subjects with irreversible toxicity that is not reasonably expected to be exacerbated by the investigational product may be included (e.g., hearing loss, peripherally neuropathy)" is True

Criterion Text In: History or current diagnosis of MDS/AML
Criterion Text Out: History or current diagnosis of MDS/AML
Criterion Rule: LK MDS == True OR LK AML == True

Criterion Text In: Active uncontrolled infection (patients completing a course of antibiotic or antiviral therapy whose infection is deemed to be controlled may be allowed on study after discussion with the PI; the PI will serve as the final arbiter regarding eligibility)
Criterion Text Out: Active uncontrolled infection

Criterion Text In: Active or symptomatic viral hepatitis or chronic liver disease
Criterion Text Out: Active or symptomatic viral hepatitis or chronic liver disease
Criterion Rule: LK HEPATITIS == True OR LK LIVER_DISEASE == True

Criterion Text In: A history of pneumonitis or extensive bilateral lung disease of non-malignant etiology
Criterion Text Out: A history of pneumonitis or extensive bilateral lung disease of non-malignant etiology
Criterion Rule: LK PNEUMONITIS == True OR LK EXTENSIVE_BILA-TERAL_LUNG_DISEASE == True

Criterion Text In: A malignancy (other than the one treated in this study) which has a >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (except for adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cancer of the cervix or Ta urothelial carcinomas)
Criterion Text Out: A malignancy (other than the one treated in this study) which has a >= 30% probability of recurrence within 24 months (except for adequately treated non-melanoma skin cancer, curatively treated in-situ cancer of the cervix or Ta urothelial carcinomas)

Criterion Text In: Any underlying medical or psychiatric condition, which in the opinion of the investigator, will make the administration of study drug hazardous or obscure the interpretation of adverse events. Examples include, but are not limited to, uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmia, recent (within 3 months) myocardial infarction, superior vena cava syndrome, extensive bilateral lung disease on high resolution computed tomography (HRCT) scan, uncontrolled seizures, history of allogeneic organ transplant, history of primary immunodeficiency or any psychiatric disorder that prohibits obtaining informed consent
Criterion Text Out: Any underlying medical or psychiatric condition, which in the opinion of the investigator, will make the administration of study drug hazardous or obscure the interpretation of adverse events. Examples include, but are not limited to, uncontrolled ventricular arrhythmia, recent (within 3 months) myocardial infarction, superior vena cava syndrome, extensive bilateral lung disease on high resolution computed tomography (HRCT) scan, uncontrolled seizures, history of allogeneic organ transplant, history of primary immunodeficiency or any psychiatric disorder that prohibits obtaining informed consent
Criterion Rule: "Any underlying medical or psychiatric condition, which in the opinion of the investigator, will make the administration of study drug hazardous or obscure the interpretation of adverse events." is True

Criterion Text In: Patients unable to swallow orally administered medication and patients with gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study medication
Criterion Text Out: Patients unable to swallow orally administered medication and patients with gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study medication
Criterion Rule: "Patients unable to swallow orally administered medication" AND "Patients with gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study medication" is True

Criterion Text In: Patients with symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compressions. A scan to confirm the absence of brain metastases is not required
Criterion Text Out: Patients with symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compressions. A scan to confirm the absence of brain metastases is not required
Procedure: Symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compressions
Criterion Rule: "Symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases or spinal cord compressions" is False

Criterion Text In: Patients with a known hypersensitivity to niraparib, carboplatin, cabazitaxel or an anti-PD1 or anti-PDL1 inhibitor
Criterion Text Out: Patients with a known hypersensitivity to niraparib, carboplatin, cabazitaxel or an anti-PD1 or anti-PDL1 inhibitor

Criterion Text In: Current or prior use of immunosuppressive medication within 21 days before the first dose of cetrelimab, with the exceptions of intranasal and inhaled corticosteroids or systemic corticosteroids at physiological doses, which are not to exceed 10 mg/day of prednisone, or an equivalent corticosteroid or steroids as pre-medication for hypersensitivity reactions (e.g. CT scan premedication)
Criterion Text Out: Current or prior use of immunosuppressive medication within 21 days before the first dose of cetrelimab, with the exceptions of intranasal and inhaled corticosteroids or systemic corticosteroids at physiological doses, which are not to exceed 10 mg/day of prednisone, or an equivalent corticosteroid or steroids as pre-medication for hypersensitivity reactions (e.g. CT scan premedication)

Criterion Text In:
Active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (including inflammatory bowel disease [e.g., colitis or Crohn's disease], diverticulitis [with the exception of diverticulosis], systemic lupus erythematosus, Sarcoidosis syndrome, or Wegener syndrome [granulomatosis with polyangiitis, Graves' disease, rheumatoid arthritis, hypophysitis, uveitis, etc.]). The following are exceptions to this criterion:
* Patients with vitiligo or alopecia
* Patients with hypothyroidism (e.g., following Hashimoto syndrome) stable on hormone replacement
* Any chronic skin condition that does not require systemic therapy
* Patients without active disease in the last 5 years may be included but only after consultation with the study physician
* Patients with celiac disease controlled by diet alone
Criterion Text Out:
Active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (including inflammatory bowel disease [e.g., colitis or Crohn's disease], diverticulitis [with the exception of diverticulosis], systemic lupus erythematosus, Sarcoidosis syndrome, or Wegener syndrome [granulomatosis with polyangiitis, Graves' disease, rheumatoid arthritis, hypophysitis, uveitis, etc.]). The following are exceptions to this criterion:
Patients with vitiligo or alopecia
Patients with hypothyroidism (e.g., following Hashimoto syndrome) stable on hormone replacement
Any chronic skin condition that does not require systemic therapy
Patients without active disease in the last 5 years may be included but only after consultation with the study physician
Patients with celiac disease controlled by diet alone
## Criterion:
    Subject has a history of any malignancy other than non-melanoma skin cancer within 3 years before screening
Output:

Criterion Text In: Receipt of live attenuated vaccination within 30 days of receiving cetrelimab
Criterion Text Out: Receipt of live attenuated vaccination within 30 days of receiving cetrelimab

Criterion Text In: Prisoners or subjects who are involuntarily incarcerated
Criterion Text Out: Prisoners or subjects who are involuntarily incarcerated
Criterion Rule: "Prisoners or subjects who are involuntarily incarcerated" is True

Criterion Text In: Subjects who are compulsorily detained for treatment of either a psychiatric or physical (e.g. infectious disease) illness
Criterion Text Out: Subjects who are compulsorily detained for treatment of either a psychiatric or physical (e.g. infectious disease) illness
